### **Data Visualization Overview**

Data Visulaization is useful for data cleaning, exploring data structure, detecting outliers and unusual groups, identifying trends and clusters, spotting local patterns, evaluating modelling output, and presenting results. It is essential for exploratory data analysis and data mining.

We have different types of variables:

1. **Quantitative:** They are numeric and continuous and represent quantities. The distribution of a single quantitative variable is typically plotted with a histogram, kernel density plot, or dot plot.

2. **Categorical:** They   express quality, attributes, categorics or characteristics. The distribution of a single categorical variable is typically plotted with a bar chart, a pie chart, or (less commonly) a tree map.

3. **Text, Image, Audio, Video, ...**


### Quantitative Variables

> **Histogram**
```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
```

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
# For creating graphs
library(ggplot2)

#Frequency
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = height)) + 
  geom_histogram(fill = "#0E4D92", color = "white", bins = 10) +
  labs(x = "Height", y = "Frequency", title = "Height of StarWars Characters") +
  theme_minimal()
```
![](Images/Hist_Frequency.PNG?raw=true)

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Percentage
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = height, y=..count.. / sum(..count..))) + 
  geom_histogram(fill = "#0E4D92", color = "white", bins = 10) +
  labs(x = "Height", y = "Percentage", title = "Height of StarWars Characters") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +
  theme_minimal()
  
```
![](Images/Hist_Percentage.PNG?raw=true)

> **Density**

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Percentage
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = height, y=..count.. / sum(..count..))) + 
  geom_density() +
  labs(x = "Height", y = "Percentage", title = "Height of StarWars Characters") +
  theme_minimal()
  
```
![](Images/Density.PNG?raw=true)


> **Dot Chart**

```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
#Percentage
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = height, y=..count.. / sum(..count..))) + 
  geom_dotplot(fill = "gold", color = "black") +
  labs(x = "Height", y = "Percentage", title = "Height of StarWars Characters") +
  theme_minimal()
  
```
![](Images/Dot.PNG?raw=true)


### Categorical Variables

> **Bar Char**

```{r message=FALSE}
# For creating graphs
library(ggplot2)

#Frequency
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = eye_color)) + 
  geom_bar(fill = "cornflowerblue", color="black") +
  labs(x = "Eye Color", y = "Frequency", title = "Eye Color of StarWars Characters") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
```
![](Images/Bar_Frequency.PNG?raw=true)

```{r message=FALSE}
#Reoprdering Data
eyec_order <- starwars %>% count(eye_color)

#Ordered Frequency
ggplot(eyec_order, aes(x = reorder(eye_color,n), y=n)) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity",fill = "cornflowerblue", color="black") +
   geom_text(aes(label = n), vjust=-0.5) +
  labs(x = "Eye Color", y = "Frequency", title = "Eye Color of StarWars Characters") +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

```
![](Images/Bar_Frequency_Ordered.PNG?raw=true)

```{r message=FALSE}

#Percents
ggplot(starwars, aes(x = eye_color, y = ..count.. / sum(..count..))) + 
  geom_bar(fill = "cornflowerblue", color="black") +
  labs(x = "Eye Color", y = "Percent", title = "Eye Color of StarWars Characters") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1)) +
  coord_flip()

```
![](Images/Bar_Percentage.PNG?raw=true)

```{r message=FALSE}
#Reordering Data
library(scales)
eyec_orderp <- starwars %>% count(eye_color) %>%
  mutate(percentage = n / sum(n), percentage_label = paste0(round(percentage*100), "%"))


#Ordered Percents
ggplot(eyec_orderp, aes(x = reorder(eye_color, -percentage), y = percentage)) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "cornflowerblue", color="black") +
  geom_text(aes(label = percentage_label), vjust = -0.25) +
  labs(x = "Eye Color", y = "Percent", title = "Eye Color of StarWars Characters") +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = scales::percent) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

```

![](Images/Bar_Percentage_Ordered.PNG?raw=true)
